intro: Urostachys martii, commonly known as the Tibetan sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the high-altitude regions of Tibet and neighboring areas. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its compact rosette of narrow, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in summer, typically arranged in clusters at the leaf axils. It thrives in arid, rocky environments and is adapted to withstand extreme temperature fluctuations. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
